Single-factor authentication (SFA), in which the user provides only one factor -- typically, a password or passcode.	 Two-factor authentication methods rely on a user providing a password, as well as a second factor, usually either a security token or a biometric factor, such as a fingerprint or facial scan. 

We provide multiple ways to keep your account secure. In addition to turning on various forms of two-factor authentication, you can also enable biometric locking and unlocking the TeleMedicine App utilizing your phoneâ€™s fingerprint.


Turn biometric access on:

Tap your menu > Tap Settings > Tap Security. 
On the Security tab, tap App Lock and toggle On. 
Authenticate with your fingerprint to unlock the TeleMedicine App. 

Turn biometric access off: 
Tap your menu > Tap Settings > Tap Security. 
On the Security tab, tap App Lock and toggle Off to disable.
